intro: Leucopogon conostephioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and related species. The plant typically grows in heathlands and dry forests, preferring well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Its small, bell-shaped flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces small, dark blue to black berries. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting native wildlife.
